product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick

review_content:
I purchased this as a replacement for a Nars multiple due to my workbag being stolen, including all my daily makeup. The color is lovely but the consistency is SO DRY. Like other reviewers mentioned it's truly impossible to blend and every time I use it I feel like i'm treating my skin harshly with all the pulling. i've started rubbing the stick on the back of my hand and mixing it with a bit of lotion to soften. Once stores open again I'm going to try and return. Very disappointed since the color and pigment is truly lovely.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: Beautiful color, nicely pigmented. However, it is a very hard "cream" so applying is difficult over foundation... I end up rubbing my base off while applying. I've tried applying with a dense brush or rubbing a beauty blender on it, but it then it doesn't show up well (or at all). If it were easier to apply I would love it, but as is, not a huge fan and rarely use it.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: My favorite highlighter! I’ve had this for 2 years and it’s no longer creamy, as it has dried out a bunch, but it still works well for my needs. A quick swipe on my cheekbones, brow arches, Cupid’s bow, and down my nose and I’m done. I blur with a finger and it’s the perfect amount of shimmer. I expect this will last many years; one suggestion is that they make this in a smaller size so it won’t dry out so fast.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: A Must Have For Caramel/Darker Skin!!!
review_content:
Chili Mango who would have thought you were just what I needed to give me that natural glow! At first I was hesitant when the Sephora Makeup Aritits grabbed this shimmer stick, but as I watched her in the mirror apply this stick to my face and blend in as if it was a blush/bronzer, I was completely in shock. I would have never on my own choose this color to use as a mixture of blush/bronzer glow. If you have a caramel/darker skin tone, this should definitely be in your makeup collection. I bought the stick the same day and now on to buying another one because I use this stick in almost all of my looks. This gives me that natural glow finish without the harsh red look that some blush products give, now don't get me wrong there's nothing wrong with the deep red blush look, it all depends on what look you are trying to achieve. But as far as a natural glow that brightens your face without overly brightening your face, you should definitely give this stick a try. Lastly I love that it is in a stick form, makes it super easy for application!!

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Great Lightweight Cream to Powder Formula
review_content:
I love these. They feel super lightweight on the skin, but provide great pigment. They aren't too shimmery or sparkly, but give you a glow that seems natural and is super pretty. I was amazed at how lightweight they feel for a cream based product. It literally is like putting a very soft textured powder onto your skin, but you're still getting that cream-like glow from within. They blend super easily too, but if you're used to applying creamier products with a brush, it might blend a bit too easy. I think it works best with fingers and a brush if you're super gentle or the pigment can disappear into the brush too quickly. I really like how they feel on the skin and I think they look beautiful. Plus, it didn't break me out or feel greasy by the end of the day. If you have dry skin, you may not like these as much and you may want a more liquid feeling cream product. Otherwise, they are great and I think the price point is good too.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I love love love this! This is my first time trying Fenty and I can’t believe how beautiful this shimmer skinstick is! A little goes a long way, but the starstruck color is absolutely perfect!! Just the right amount of shimmer. This will last a very long time too.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: It's great!! If you know what you're buying.
review_content:
It's great and does what it says it will! The colors are nicely pigmented, not extremely glittery, and are fairly long lasting. Other ratings didn't make sense to me. This is NOT a creamy, dewy or wet formula. It has shimmer. It is cream to powder. Powders are generally dry. Please read the description before you buy. You wouldn't just dab on powder and blend it with a beauty blender... this sets down as a powder... use ur brush or fingers. It is best to warm on hand and then apply to face. I personally don't think there is too little product either... most sticks don't take up the whole tubing and it takes a lot to use this up. I am thinking the line will expand to different finishes -- like the PURRL stick being creamy and dewy. Please for the love of god read before you blindly buy whatever.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
I got 3 of these when they were on sale. I’m very very pale. (Fenty 100, KVD 41) The color Yacht Lyfe is my favorite out of the 3 I picked. I use it for my blush & pair it with my Marc Jacobs Runway highlighter- it’s just stunning. Its very creamy & has great pigmentation with a nice glowy finish. I warm it up on the back of my hand & apply with a sponge. I also got Starstuck. I thought it was going to be too dark to use as a highlight, but it catches light beautifully & actually works on my skin tone. The last color I got was Confetti. Based on the description & photos, I thought would be mostly pearl with a slight blue/purple shift, but it’s actually just straight up blue & purple glitter. Looks more like the color Unicorn in the photos, so I’ll be returning that one just because I can’t use the color, but the formula is still gorgeous.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Deep', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
You can use this as a lipstick, eye shadow, or blush/highlighter. I bought Ridiic, Unicorn, Yatch Life, Pink Lemonade, and Chili Mango. These colors are PHENOMENAL!! They are nothing like any other brand. I warm it on my hand, and apply it, and it melts into my skin, and is long-lasting. The shimmer is beautiful, and not over-powering (dewy look). The only flaw is what most people are saying, if you don't warm it on your hand, it does not go on smooth. I wish Fenty would just make another batch with a creamier formula. It would be a HIT because no other brand has this. They're magnetic, they have a matching magnetic brush, they are compact for portability, and the colors are amazing! They really need to make a creamier formula, but I guess they wont because enough people are buying these regardless of the flaw. I still love these! My favorites are RIdiic, Pink Lemonade and Chili Mango. Chili Mango looks great layered on Yatch Life. Yeah, you can layer these, and they look even better!

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: you won’t regret it picking up a couple shades
review_content:
oh let me just tell you.. I am OBSESSED. I usually wear trippin or pink lemonade as a blush by swirling my brush directly on to the product then onto my face, but find that just going over my cheeks again with a sponge (w no additional product) gives it that ‘seamless flush of color’ look. I also use trippin, pink lemonade, starstruck, and sinamon as eye shadows by going in directly onto my eyelids then blending w my finger or crease brush. Then finally, I’ll use sinamon as a bronzer that’ll also give me that slight warmth and glow by using a brush to apply and sponge to blend again. I think it took me a while to figure out the best methods of application depending on how you want to use them bc sometimes going in directly onto my face with other products already on didn’t always workout for me, and I didn’t want to feel like I was ‘wasting’ product by having excess left on the back of my hand after having to ‘warm up’ the product.

I find that the product is best applied with a brush for me especially if the brush is a little damp. I purchased this in August 2019 and still have a good amount of product remaining.

This isn't a product you can just rub on your cheek and blend it out, I found its easier to work with when you warm it up on your hand or fingers then apply it that way. I docked a star because there just isn't a whole lot of product in there sadly.

product_name: FENTY BEAUTY by Rihanna Match Stix Shimmer Skinstick
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Ebony', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I will admit, these match stix shimmers are a bit of a learning curve. The first time I applied this I put it straight on my face and try to blend it in. It looked AWFUL, it picked up the rest of my makeup, and I had a big patch of brown on it. Then I saw a technique of someone rubbing the stick on the back of their hand, taking a makeup sponge, dipping into it and THEN apply it that way. And holy crap was that the solution. It looks so beautiful, so natural on the skin (if you are dark skin lol) and I honestly went back and bought 8 more shades! So versatile. You can use them on the lips, as a highlight, as an eyeshadow but it just requires a bit of different techniques to get it just right. It's worth it though!
